subject: Re: [junit] Digest Number 1403
msgSnippet: How can I unsubscribe this? Amit Gandhi ... === message truncated === __________________________________________________ Do You Yahoo!? Tired of spam?  Yahoo!
messageBody:
How can I unsubscribe this?

Amit Gandhi
--- junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:

>
> There are 4 messages in this issue.
>
> Topics in this digest:
>
> 1. Re: Re: Junit Test Selections for
> testfunc()
> From: "J. B. Rainsberger"
> <jbrains@...>
> 2. Testing Session Components
> From: "namwonmkw" <namwonmkw@...>
> 3. using JUnit for the existing project
> From: "manjula_g_2001"
> <manjula_g_2001@...>
> 4. Re: using JUnit for the existing project
> From: Jason Rogers
> <jacaetevha@...>
>
>
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 1
> Date: Mon, 17 Jan 2005 15:34:13 -0500
> From: "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...>
> Subject: Re: Re: Junit Test Selections for
> testfunc()
>
> love wrote:
> >
> > I tried doing this, but it executed only the last
> one.:myruntests
> > [1]); 4 times::
> > Why is it so???
>
> Each test is a different object, but you added the
> same object (test)
> three times. Only the last test executes because you
> did this:
>
> create test
> change its name to A, then add it to the list
> change its name to B, then add it to the list again
> change its name to C, then add it to the list a
> third time
>
> At the end, you have /the same test/ in the list
> three times, and
> they're all named C (in your case, "test1").
>
> So each test has to be a separate object.
>
> suite.addTest(createMyTest("test7"));
> suite.addTest(createMyTest("test3"));
> suite.addTest(createMyTest("test1"));
>
> public Test createMyTest(String name) {
> MyTest test = new MyTest();
> test.setName(name);
> return test;
> }
>
> Or add this constructor to MyTest:
>
> public MyTest(String name) {
> setName(name);
> }
>
> Now:
>
> suite.addTest(new MyTest("test7"));
> ...
>
> Either way, the three tests are different objects,
> so they can execute
> different test methods.
>
> I hope this helps.
> --
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com
> Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for
> Programmer Testing
>
>
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 2
> Date: Tue, 18 Jan 2005 00:08:11 -0000
> From: "namwonmkw" <namwonmkw@...>
> Subject: Testing Session Components
>
>
>
> I would like to test a shopping cart that resides in
> the session. Is
> there a way to keep session scoped data between
> cacatus test? Or
> should I setup my shopping cart for each test with
> the appropriate data?
>
> Thanks,
>
> Matt Wright
>
> PS I am using ATG if that helps.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
________________________________________________________________________

> Message: 3
> Date: Tue, 18 Jan 2005 09:14:42 -0000
> From: "manjula_g_2001" <manjula_g_2001@...>
> Subject: using JUnit for the existing project
>
>
>
> Hello,
>
>
> Can any body tell me,how can i use the junit to
> test my project
> which already has so many classes in it.
>
>
> Thank you,
> Manjula
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 4
> Date: Tue, 18 Jan 2005 10:46:26 -0500
> From: Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@...>
> Subject: Re: using JUnit for the existing project
>
> On Tuesday 18 January 2005 04:14, manjula_g_2001
> wrote:
> > Hello,
> >
> >
> > ï¿½ Can any body tell me,how can i use the junit to
> test my project
> > which already has so many classes in it.
>
> Start writing tests...
>
> Seriously, there are several approaches to testing
> code that is already
> written. One popular approach is to start by
> writing a test that exposes a
> known bug then fix your code to make the test pass.
>
> You could Google for "test legacy code". One of the
> hits I got there was a
> good page on Ward's WIKI at
> http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?UnitTestingLegacyCode.
>
> --
> Jason Rogers
>
> "I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live;
> yet not I,
> but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now
> live in
> the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who
> loved
> me, and gave himself for me."
> Galatians 2:20
>
>
>
